page.title: 19OFFLEY GRANGE
page.content: A lot of the cereal is not sold but used for feeding the cattle.By special feeding with cereal the farmer can raise cattle to slaughter weight in 12 months,instead of 24 months when fed on grass.He has 150 breeding ewes.The lambs are sold for their meat and the ewes are shorn for their wool.He is a member of the Central Regional Board of the Wool Marketing Board.A statutary marketing board handling the whole of the National Clip. The farmer owns two hunting horses, which as Master of the Hunt,he uses for Fox Hunting.He is Master of'The Enfield Chace'.The Fox hunting season is from the beginning of November to the end of March.During that time they meet twice a week.The hounds are kenneled at Hoddeston and the number of people taking part in a Hunt varies from 25 to about 140.
